Enum.Name: NSSegmentStyle
Enum.Description: The following constants specify the visual style used to display the segmented control. They are used by segmentStyle.

Cases.Name: NSSegmentStyleAutomatic
Cases.Description: The appearance of the segmented control is automatically determined based on the type of window in which the control is displayed and the position within the window.

Cases.Name: NSSegmentStyleRounded
Cases.Description: The control is displayed using the rounded style.

Cases.Name: NSSegmentStyleTexturedRounded
Cases.Description: The control is displayed using the textured rounded style. In macOS 10.7 and later, this style uses the artwork defined for NSSegmentStyleTexturedSquare, so you should specify NSSegmentStyleTexturedSquare instead.

Cases.Name: NSSegmentStyleRoundRect
Cases.Description: The control is displayed using the round rect style.

Cases.Name: NSSegmentStyleTexturedSquare
Cases.Description: The control is displayed using the textured square style.

Cases.Name: NSSegmentStyleCapsule
Cases.Description: The control is displayed using the capsule style. In macOS 10.7 and later, this style uses the artwork defined for NSSegmentStyleTexturedSquare, so you should specify NSSegmentStyleTexturedSquare instead.

Cases.Name: NSSegmentStyleSmallSquare
Cases.Description: The control is displayed using the small square style.

Cases.Name: NSSegmentStyleSeparated
Cases.Description: The segments in the control are displayed very close to each other but not touching. For example, Safari in macOS 10.10 and later uses this style for the previous and next page segmented control.
